questions.question: Research on meaning suggests that:
options: Only certain people are capable of finding meaning
Meaning comes from a single life purpose
Meaning can come from multiple sources and changes over time
Meaning is irrelevant to psychological wellbeing

questions.question: The relationship between meaning and happiness is:
options: Identical - meaning equals happiness
Opposite - meaningful lives are unhappy
Related but distinct - meaningful lives often involve difficulty alongside fulfillment
Completely unrelated

questions.question: Values differ from goals in that:
options: Values can be achieved and completed
Values are ongoing directions while goals are achievable endpoints
Goals are more important than values
Values are assigned to you while goals are chosen

questions.question: Common sources of meaning include:
options: Only career and achievement
Relationships, contribution, growth, and transcendence
Material possessions primarily
Status and recognition

questions.question: When meaning fades or you experience existential doubt:
options: You should ignore it and stay busy
It's a sign of permanent damage
It can be an invitation for reflection and potential growth
It means you've made wrong life choices
